title: A Matter of Integrity
devotional:
Old Man Hemlock, they called him. Not to his face, of course. He owned the general store, and in a town as small as Havenwood, that meant he held a certain amount of sway. But he was… particular. Every item in its place, every penny accounted for, every word measured. People whispered he was tight-fisted, that he'd squeeze a nickel till the buffalo bellowed. One crisp autumn day, young Thomas, barely ten years old, was sent to Hemlock's store for a loaf of bread. He clutched the coins his mother had given him, worn smooth with age and use. As Hemlock rang up the purchase, Thomas, mesmerized by a small, wooden toy soldier on the counter, reached out and turned it over in his hands. Hemlock's eyes narrowed. “That’s not for playing with, boy. It’s for sale.” Thomas, flustered, quickly put it back, but in his haste, a single coin slipped from his grasp and rolled under the counter, disappearing into the shadows. Shame burned in his cheeks. He didn’t have enough money now. Hemlock, with a sigh that could curdle milk, got down on his hands and knees, retrieved the coin, and held it up. “Always be careful with what you have, boy. A penny saved is a penny earned.” Thomas mumbled an apology, paid for the bread, and fled the store, the weight of his clumsiness heavy on his small shoulders.

Years later, Thomas, now a grown man, stood before the townsfolk of Havenwood. Old Man Hemlock had passed away, and to everyone's surprise, he had named Thomas as the executor of his estate. The will was simple: Hemlock's assets were to be liquidated, and the proceeds used to establish a scholarship fund for the children of Havenwood. But as Thomas delved into Hemlock's affairs, he discovered a discrepancy. A significant sum of money was missing, unaccounted for. Whispers began again, darker this time. Had Hemlock been hiding something? Had he cheated the town? Thomas knew he could easily sweep the issue under the rug, attribute it to poor record-keeping, and no one would be the wiser. But something stopped him. The memory of that single, lost coin, the sting of Hemlock’s words, and a deep-seated sense of what was right. He spent weeks poring over ledgers, tracing transactions, and making phone calls. Finally, he found it: an old, overlooked investment account, tucked away and forgotten. The missing money, plus accrued interest, more than covered the scholarship fund. Standing before the town again, Thomas announced the discovery. He could see the relief in their eyes, the restoration of Hemlock's reputation, and a quiet sense of pride that they had chosen him, a man of integrity, to do the right thing, even when it was hard.
image_description: A close-up of weathered, leather-bound ledger with a fountain pen resting on top, bathed in warm lamplight.
insights: The story illustrates that integrity is not about perfection, but about consistently striving to do what is right, even when no one is watching. Proverbs 11:3 states, 'The integrity of the upright guides them, but the unfaithful are destroyed by their duplicity.' This verse highlights the guiding force that integrity plays in our lives, leading us towards righteousness and away from the destructive path of deceit. Furthermore, Titus 2:7-8 encourages us to be examples of good works, showing integrity and seriousness in our teaching, so that our message cannot be condemned.
prayer: Heavenly Father, I ask for strength to live with unwavering integrity in all areas of my life. When faced with difficult choices, remind me of Your principles and give me the courage to choose the path of righteousness, even when it is challenging. Help me to be a person of honesty and trustworthiness, reflecting Your character in all that I do. Guide me to value integrity above personal gain or approval. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: In what areas of your life do you find it most challenging to maintain integrity? What small steps can you take today to strengthen your commitment to honesty and ethical behavior? How can you cultivate a greater awareness of your actions and their impact on others?
